intro: Heliotropium stenostachyum, commonly known as the narrow-stalked heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant produces small, violet or purple flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough or hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
